alert.note: Alert for Central Mountains; Sevier Valley (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 19 at 10:46AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR FLOODING IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of Utah, including the following areas, Central Mountains, Sevier Valley, Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity, Glen Canyon Recreation Area/Lake Powell, South Central Utah and Western Canyonlands. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of slot canyons, normally dry washes, recent burn scars, rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An ongoing monsoon surge combined with increasing tropical moisture will bring an increased threat of flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
